intro: Acer platanoides var. albovariegatum, commonly known as the white-variegated Norway maple, is a deciduous tree native to Europe. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that display a striking white and green variegation pattern. The tree produces small, winged samaras as its seed dispersal method. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and urban landscapes.
